content.title: Hypersensitivity Vasculitis
content.description: Small vessel vasculitis triggered by external antigens (drugs, infections) affecting predominantly the skin.
content.clinical_pearl: Usually self-limited once trigger removed; systemic vasculitis should be excluded if visceral involvement
